summary: Error messages when connecting to Temporal Cloud with an invalid serverRootCACertificate are cryptic, showing 'Failed to connect before the deadline' instead of a TLS-related error. User requests improved diagnostics to help troubleshoot certificate configuration issues.
userImpact: Users troubleshooting connection failures to Temporal Cloud with invalid TLS certificates receive misleading error messages that point them in the wrong direction, making diagnosis slow and frustrating.
rootCause: gRPC treats connection-level TLS failures as transient errors and retries transparently, masking the actual certificate validation error with a generic 'deadline exceeded' message. TLS libraries close connections without detailed error information on handshake failure.
proposedFix: Improve error messaging to indicate TLS validation or certificate-related issues when connecting to Temporal Cloud, possibly by detecting and surfacing certificate validation failures before they become generic timeout errors.
keyQuote: I had expected the message to be something related to TLS validation or similar, not a failed connection before the deadline...
